dn25:7.16.pli: Iṅgha tvaṁ maṁ, nigrodha, sake ācariyake adhijegucche pañhaṁ puccha:
dn25:7.16.en: Please ask me a question about the higher mortification in disgust of sin in your own tradition:

dn25:7.17.pli: ‘kathaṁ santā nu kho, bhante, tapojigucchā paripuṇṇā hoti, kathaṁ aparipuṇṇā’”ti?
dn25:7.17.en: ‘How are the conditions for the mortification in disgust of sin completed, and how are they incomplete?’”

dn25:8.2.pli: “mayaṁ kho, bhante, tapojigucchāvādā tapojigucchāsārā tapojigucchāallīnā viharāma.
dn25:8.2.en: “Sir, we teach mortification in disgust of sin, regarding it as essential and clinging to it.

dn25:8.3.pli: Kathaṁ santā nu kho, bhante, tapojigucchā paripuṇṇā hoti, kathaṁ aparipuṇṇā”ti?
dn25:8.3.en: How are the conditions for the mortification in disgust of sin completed, and how are they incomplete?”

dn25:8.23.pli: yadi evaṁ sante tapojigucchā paripuṇṇā vā hoti aparipuṇṇā vā”ti?
dn25:8.23.en: If this is so, is the mortification in disgust of sin complete, or incomplete?”

dn25:8.24.pli: “Addhā kho, bhante, evaṁ sante tapojigucchā paripuṇṇā hoti, no aparipuṇṇā”ti.
dn25:8.24.en: “Clearly, sir, if that is so the mortification in disgust of sin is complete, not incomplete.”

dn25:15.15.pli: yadi evaṁ sante tapojigucchā parisuddhā vā hoti aparisuddhā vā”ti?
dn25:15.15.en: If this is so, is the mortification in disgust of sin purified or not?”

dn25:15.17.pli: “Na kho, nigrodha, ettāvatā tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca;
dn25:15.17.en: “No, Nigrodha, at this point the mortification in disgust of sin has not yet reached the peak and the pith.

dn25:16.1.pli: “Kittāvatā pana, bhante, tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca?
dn25:16.1.en: “But at what point, sir, does the mortification in disgust of sin reach the peak and the pith?

dn25:17.7.pli: Yadi evaṁ sante tapojigucchā parisuddhā vā hoti aparisuddhā vā”ti?
dn25:17.7.en: If this is so, is the mortification in disgust of sin purified or not?”

dn25:17.9.pli: “Na kho, nigrodha, ettāvatā tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca;
dn25:17.9.en: “No, Nigrodha, at this point the mortification in disgust of sin has not yet reached the peak and the pith.

dn25:18.1.pli: “Kittāvatā pana, bhante, tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca?
dn25:18.1.en: “But at what point, sir, does the mortification in disgust of sin reach the peak and the pith?

dn25:18.15.pli: yadi evaṁ sante tapojigucchā parisuddhā vā hoti aparisuddhā vā”ti?
dn25:18.15.en: If this is so, is the mortification in disgust of sin purified or not?”

dn25:18.17.pli: “Na kho, nigrodha, ettāvatā tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca;
dn25:18.17.en: “No, Nigrodha, at this point the mortification in disgust of sin has not yet reached the peak and the pith.

dn25:19.1.pli: “Kittāvatā pana, bhante, tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca?
dn25:19.1.en: “But at what point, sir, does the mortification in disgust of sin reach the peak and the pith?

dn25:19.14.pli: yadi evaṁ sante tapojigucchā parisuddhā vā hoti aparisuddhā vā”ti?
dn25:19.14.en: If this is so, is the mortification in disgust of sin purified or not?”

dn25:19.16.pli: “Ettāvatā kho, nigrodha, tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca.
dn25:19.16.en: “Nigrodha, at this point the mortification in disgust of sin has reached the peak and the pith.

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 25
The Lion’s Roar at Udumbarikā’s Monastery
1. On the Wanderer Nigrodha

an4.196:2.2.en: purification of ethics, and mortification in disgust of sin.

an4.196:3.2.pli: Ye te, sāḷha, samaṇabrāhmaṇā tapojigucchāvādā tapojigucchāsārā tapojigucchāallīnā viharanti, abhabbā te oghassa nittharaṇāya.
an4.196:3.2.en: But those ascetics and brahmins who teach mortification in disgust of sin—regarding it as essential and clinging to it—are incapable of crossing the flood.

an4.196:6.1.pli: “Evamevaṁ kho, sāḷha, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā tapojigucchāvādā tapojigucchāsārā tapojigucchāallīnā viharanti, abhabbā te oghassa nittharaṇāya.
an4.196:6.1.en: “In the same way, Sāḷha, those ascetics and brahmins who teach mortification in disgust of sin—regarding it as essential and clinging to it—are incapable of crossing the flood.

an4.196:7.1.pli: Ye ca kho te, sāḷha, samaṇabrāhmaṇā na tapojigucchāvādā na tapojigucchāsārā na tapojigucchāallīnā viharanti, bhabbā te oghassa nittharaṇāya.
an4.196:7.1.en: But those ascetics and brahmins who don’t teach mortification in disgust of sin—not regarding it as essential or clinging to it—are capable of crossing the flood.

an4.196:10.1.pli: “Evamevaṁ kho, sāḷha, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā na tapojigucchāvādā na tapojigucchāsārā na tapojigucchāallīnā viharanti, bhabbā te oghassa nittharaṇāya.
an4.196:10.1.en: “In the same way, Sāḷha, those ascetics and brahmins who don’t teach mortification in disgust of sin—not regarding it as essential or clinging to it—are capable of crossing the flood.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 4
20. The Great Chapter
196. With Sāḷha

dn8:21.5.en: There are, Kassapa, some ascetics and brahmins who teach mortification in disgust of sin.

dn8:21.6.en: They praise mortification in disgust of sin in many ways.

dn8:21.7.pli: Yāvatā, kassapa, ariyā paramā tapojigucchā, nāhaṁ tattha attano samasamaṁ samanupassāmi, kuto bhiyyo.
dn8:21.7.en: But as far as the highest noble mortification in disgust of sin goes, I don’t see anyone who’s my equal, still less my superior.

dn8:21.8.pli: Atha kho ahameva tattha bhiyyo, yadidaṁ adhijegucchaṁ.
dn8:21.8.en: Rather, I am the one who is superior when it comes to the higher mortification in disgust of sin.

dn8:23.2.pli: Tatra maṁ aññataro tapabrahmacārī nigrodho nāma adhijegucche pañhaṁ apucchi.
dn8:23.2.en: There a certain practitioner of self-mortification named Nigrodha asked me about the higher mortification in disgust of sin.

sn2.30:4.1.en: “Through mortification in disgust of sin he became well restrained.

30. The Disciples of Various Sectarians

mn12:47.1.pli: Tatrāssu me idaṁ, sāriputta, jegucchismiṁ hoti—
mn12:47.1.en: And this is what my living in disgust of sin was like.

mn12:47.4.en: Such was my living in disgust of sin.
